name: Espresso Machine
description: A semi-automatic espresso machine designed for producing rich and authentic espresso.
usage: Preheat the machine before use, grind coffee finely, tamp evenly, and clean the portafilter after each extraction.

name: French Press
description: A classic immersion brewer that delivers a full-bodied and robust coffee by steeping grounds directly in hot water.
usage: Use coarse-ground coffee, steep for four minutes, then press the plunger slowly to avoid bitterness.

name: Pour Over Dripper
description: A manual brewing device that emphasizes clarity and aroma through controlled water flow and extraction.
usage: Rinse the filter first, pour water slowly in circular motions, and maintain a consistent brew ratio.

name: Gooseneck Kettle
description: A precision kettle designed to give complete control over water flow for manual brewing methods.
usage: Heat water to the desired temperature and pour slowly for accurate saturation during brewing.

name: Manual Grinder
description: A compact hand grinder with adjustable burrs for consistent grind size across various brewing styles.
usage: Adjust grind size according to brew method and clean burrs regularly for optimal performance.

name: AeroPress Maker
description: A portable coffee maker that uses pressure and immersion to produce smooth, low-acidity coffee.
usage: Use medium-fine grind, stir briefly, press gently, and rinse components after each use.

name: Moka Pot
description: A stovetop brewer that uses steam pressure to produce espresso-like coffee.
usage: Use medium-fine grind, fill water to safety valve, and remove from heat just as brewing finishes.

name: Cold Brew Maker
description: A large-capacity brewer designed for steeping coffee in cold water over 12–24 hours.
usage: Use coarse grind, steep in fridge, and dilute concentrate with water or milk before serving.

name: V60 Dripper
description: A conical pour-over dripper with spiral ridges for controlled, even extraction.
usage: Rinse filter, bloom coffee, and pour in slow spirals for maximum flavor clarity.

name: Coffee Scale
description: A precision digital scale with timer for accurate brew ratios and consistency.
usage: Place brewer on scale, tare weight, and monitor water output during pour.

name: Variable Temp Kettle
description: An electric kettle with adjustable temperature settings for different brew methods.
usage: Set water temp (e.g., 92°C for pour-over, 85°C for delicate greens), then pour with gooseneck control.

name: Espresso Tamper
description: A tool for evenly compressing coffee grounds in an espresso portafilter.
usage: Apply 30 lbs of pressure uniformly to create a level, compact puck for optimal extraction.
